column4: Gnome Main Menu Editor (aka alacarte) won't change some menu names. I can't edit GIMP Image Manipulation Program, for example. I change the name, and nothing happens. Reboot doesn't fix it.
I take it you aren't using Ubuntu 7.10
It's probably Ubuntu's gettext support messing crap up again
No clue where the actual config files are that alacarte is editing?
Oh, I know that, I wrote it :P
The problem is that alacarte is calling gnome-desktop-item-edit which edits Name[en] but thanks to Ubuntu changes this key is ignored and it needs to change Name
So this is an Ubuntu-only problem that needs to be fixed in gnome-desktop-item-edit which is a part of gnome-panel
hehe... I'm quite happy with it otherwise and don't mind getting my fingers dirty a bit.
So, for example, I would do this: "sudo mv Take/ Screenshot.desktop Screenshot.desktop"
it's the contents of the file which luckily are ini-type (like windows .ini files) so very easy to edit by hand
Ahh.. I see it now. Super. Cheers.

Re: Antkin "In the last two hours all he has done is greet people who enter the room. Then, he tells them to google it or go post on the forums. At least two people have left immediately after being told this before someone else could step in."
